title: Please help ID this font!
content:
Hi!

Could someone help ID this font? Also do you know of any similar fonts?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Maison-Kitsune\_logo\_2013-02-185121d5b9405d97-54475353.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/typophile.com/files/Maison-Kitsune_logo_2013-02-185121d5b9405d97-54475353.jpg) | 25.27 KB |
author: AndreanaP

comments.content: Font is called "didotyounger", created exclusively for [Kitsuné](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/www.kitsune.fr/) by [Åbäke](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/abake.fr/) (co-founder of Kitsuné).

Since you asked about similar fonts, it seems very similar to Touraine [http://typophile.com/files/Le\_Touraine\_4497.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/typophile.com/files/Le_Touraine_4497.png) or Chambord [http://luc.devroye.org/RogerExcoffon--ChambordMaigre.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/luc.devroye.org/RogerExcoffon--ChambordMaigre.png) – but both are difficult to find digitized versions of.

Not exactly the same, but similar...Seaside Display Regular  
http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/andrijtype/seaside/

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202013-09-01%20at%207_5442.31.13%20PM.png)

If you need to be as close as possible to original, the "best" would probably be to chop off serifs from a [Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/myfonts.us/td-vfz5vw), obviously stated by the font name "DIDOTyounger".  
Some alternatives, out-of-the-box: [Chong Modern MTI](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/chong-modern), [Britannic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/britannic), [Peignot LT](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414054624/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot)
